subject: Personal Finance
title: The Retirement Savings Gap
description: Learn The Retirement Savings Gap in one minute.

hook.text: 22% of Americans have less than $5,000 saved for retirement. The crisis is already here.

buildup.text: Stagnant wages, rising costs, and student debt have left many unable to save meaningfully.

discovery.text: The gap between what people have and what they need runs into trillions of dollars nationwide.

twist.text: Many people plan to 'work longer' as their strategy. But health problems and layoffs often force early retirement.

climax.text: The average age of actual retirement is 62 â€” three years before most people planned to retire.

punchline.text: Planning to work forever isn't a plan.

quiz.question: Why is 'working longer' a risky retirement strategy?
options: Health problems or layoffs often force earlier retirement
